title: Anxiety Disorders and Panic Responses Decision Tree

NODE_A.question: Is the anxiety primarily linked to physiological symptoms or loss of control?

NODE_A1.description: Anxiety with respiratory control fears (e.g., fear of stopping breathing)

LEAF_A1A1.description: Fear of stopping breathing, often after physical exertion

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_A: Your Body Knows What It's Doing

LEAF_A2A1.description: Anxiety with sensation of losing control over the body

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_B: You're Not Dying, You're Feeling

NODE_A3.description: Generalized fear of dying or losing control

LEAF_A3A1.description: Persistent hypervigilance, catastrophic misinterpretation of body signals

NODE_B.question: Is the anxiety centered on a specific context or life phase?

NODE_B1.description: Agoraphobia with panic and obsessive control fears

LEAF_B1A1.description: Highway and confinement fear, emotional overload in family context

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_D: Finding Inner Safety in an Unpredictable World

LEAF_B2A1.description: Guilt towards deceased mother, burden of being the 'pillar'

NODE_B3.description: Elderly with fear of dying alone

LEAF_B3A1.description: Morning anxiety, solitude, reconnection with the deceased

LEAF_NO1.description: No current anxiety linked to body or loss of control

recommendation.script: SCRIPT_G: Explore emotional anchors or cognitive schemas
